articles.title: Elevated genetic risk for multiple sclerosis emerged in steppe pastoralist populations - Nature.com
articles.description: Analysis of a large ancient genome dataset shows that genetic risk for multiple sclerosis rose in steppe pastoralists, providing insight into how genetic ancestry from the Neolithic and Bronze Age has shaped modern immune responses.
